alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 4:43PM EDT until July 04 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and southern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer and Monmouth. In southern New Jersey...Burlington and Ocean. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Holly, Bordentown, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Georgetown, Jobstown, Columbus, Crosswicks, Browns Mills, Jacksonville, White Horse, and Florence-Roebling. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 7A. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 45 and 46...and between mile markers 49 and 61. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
